item.title: 全球经济图表：美元下滑让人想起尼克松
item.description: 由于唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）征收关税并试图重塑全球贸易，美元有望创下自理查德-尼克松（Richard Nixon）入主白宫以来美国总统任期头 100 天的最差表现。【原文：The dollar is on pace for its worst performance during the first 100 days of a US presidency since Richard Nixon was in the White House as Donald Trump imposes tariffs and attempts to reshape global trade.】

item.title: S&P Global 确认土耳其评级为 BB-，警告增长面临风险
item.description: S&P全球评级公司确认土耳其的长期外币债务评级为BB-，并保持其前景稳定，同时警告经济增长面临风险。【原文：S&P Global Ratings affirmed Turkey’s long-term foreign currency debt rating at BB-, and kept the outlook stable, while warning of risks to growth.】

item.title: 更多关于 TikTok 期权交易员如何变得安静的信息
item.description:
本-埃弗特谈希腊人。【原文：

Benn Eifert on the Greeks.

】

item.title: 嘀嗒期权交易员如何变得真正安静（播客）
item.description: 嘀嗒期权交易员如何变得真正安静（播客）【原文：How TikTok Options Traders Got Real Quiet (Podcast)】

item.title: 英国政府的钢铁计划有可能因贸易战而功亏一篑
item.description: 英国钢铁公司的直接危机已经过去，但英国政府通过控制该国最后一家原生钢生产商，将自己置于全球贸易战的交火之中。【原文：The immediate crisis at British Steel has passed, but by taking control of the country’s last maker of virgin steel, the UK government has put itself in the crossfire of a global trade war.】

item.title: 南非财政部在预算案翻来覆去之后面临信誉考验
item.description: 两个月来，南非国家财政部不得不在预算提案上两次出尔反尔，其可信度正受到审查。【原文：The credibility of South Africa’s National Treasury is under scrutiny after two months in which it’s had to backtrack on its budget proposals twice.】

item.title: 欧洲大学在政治混乱中努力保持中立
item.description: 早在特朗普政府开始打压高等教育之前，大西洋两岸的大学在处理因政治问题引发的校园冲突方面就面临着巨大压力。【原文：Universities on both sides of the Atlantic were under intense pressure to deal with campus conflict over political issues long before the Trump administration started cracking down on higher education.】

item.title: 法官对被驱逐的两岁美国公民表示 "怀疑
item.description: 一名联邦法官希望特朗普政府官员回答，为什么要将一名两岁的美国公民和她的母亲一起驱逐回洪都拉斯，而孩子的父亲却试图阻止这一行动。【原文：A federal judge wants answers from Trump administration officials why they deported a two-year-old US citizen to Honduras with her mother, as the child’s father tried to halt the effort.】

item.title: 众议院共和党起草联邦雇员养老金制度削减草案
item.description: 在共和党人正在美国众议院审议的巨额税收和支出方案中，联邦雇员的养老金福利将被削减，这是对受到埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）削减成本努力影响的员工队伍的又一次抨击。【原文：Federal employee pension benefits are set to be pared back in Republicans’ giant tax and spending package working its way through the US House, another slap at a workforce roiled by Elon Musk’s cost-cutting efforts.】

item.title: 中国在贸易紧张局势中重申实现 2025 年增长目标
item.description: 中国财政部长本周早些时候在华盛顿表示，尽管贸易紧张局势和不确定性不断升级，中国仍将采取措施实现 5%左右的年度经济增长目标。【原文：China will take measures to achieve its annual economic growth target of around 5% despite escalating trade tensions and uncertainties, the country’s finance minister said in Washington earlier this week.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 XAI 控股公司正在讨论融资 200 亿美元的事宜
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 XAI 控股公司正在与投资者洽谈，为其新合并的人工智能初创公司和社交媒体业务筹集约 200 亿美元的资金。【原文：Elon Musk’s XAI Holdings is in talks with investors to raise roughly $20 billion in funding for his newly combined artificial intelligence startup and social media business, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: NV5 吸引了竞争对手 Acuren 的收购兴趣
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，最近几周，工程和检测服务供应商 NV5 Global Inc.【原文：NV5 Global Inc., an engineering and inspection-services provider, has drawn takeover interest from rival Acuren Corp. in recent weeks, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 浏览器主管告诉法官，只有谷歌才能运行 Chrome 浏览器
item.description: Chrome 浏览器负责人证实，鉴于 Chrome 浏览器与 Alphabet 公司其他部门的 "相互依存关系"，谷歌是唯一一家能够提供其流行的 Chrome 浏览器目前所具有的功能和特性的公司。【原文：Google is the only company that can offer the level of features and functionality that its popular Chrome web browser has today, given its “interdependencies” on other parts of the Alphabet Inc. unit, the head of Chrome testified.】

item.title: 迪尔起诉瑞波公司诽谤，硅谷恩怨升级
item.description: 身价 120 亿美元的硅谷初创公司 Deel Inc. 与人力资源和薪资软件市场的头号竞争对手之间的激烈法律斗争正在升级。【原文：Deel Inc., a $12 billion Silicon Valley startup, is escalating a bitter legal fight with its top rival in the market for human resources and payroll software.】

item.title: 肯-格里芬批评特朗普关税：这些工作不会回来了
item.description: Citadel 创始人肯-格里芬（Ken Griffin）扩大了他对特朗普政府贸易政策的批评，称关税不会像总统预期的那样使美国制造业工作岗位回流，美国应该发挥自己的优势。【原文：Citadel founder Ken Griffin extended his criticism of the Trump administration’s trade policy, saying that tariffs won’t bring back American manufacturing jobs the way that the president anticipates and the country should play to its strengths instead.】

item.title: 前员工称，Shopify 曾向卡尼提供 2020 年的总裁职位
item.description: 据这家电子商务公司的一位前高管透露，Shopify 公司曾试图在加拿大总理马克-卡尼于 2020 年卸任英格兰银行行长一职后，聘请他担任公司总裁。【原文：Shopify Inc. tried to recruit Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney to be its president after he left his job as governor of the Bank of England in 2020, according to a former executive of the e-commerce company.】

item.title: 鲍威尔在国际货币基金组织闭门会议上就独立性问题赢得掌声
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）在与来自世界各地的财政主管聚会时强调，央行必须远离政治，以确保它们能够专注于保持通胀稳定和就业率高企。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell used a gathering of finance chiefs from around the world to stress that central banks must be shielded from politics to ensure they can focus on keeping inflation stable and employment high, according to people who listened to his remarks.】

item.title: 美国官员采用 "有组织 "框架处理贸易谈判
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府已经起草了一个框架，以处理与贸易伙伴的谈判，这些伙伴急于达成避免关税上调的协议。【原文：President Donald Trump’s administration has drafted a framework to handle negotiations with trading partners rushing to secure deals to avert tariff hikes, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Compass 因私人房源纠纷起诉西雅图地区 MLS
item.description: Compass Inc. 加大了改变房屋在线销售方式的力度，对西雅图地区一家经纪公司提起诉讼，该经纪公司声称该公司正在从事反竞争行为。【原文：Compass Inc. ratcheted up its fight to change how homes are sold online, filing a lawsuit against a Seattle-area group the brokerage alleges is engaging in anticompetitive practices.】

item.title: 标准普尔称强生罕见的 AAA 评级不再有风险
item.description: S&P 全球评级公司周五表示，强生公司（Johnson & Johnson）不再面临评级下调的风险，该公司是目前少数几家拥有最高信用评级的公司之一。【原文：Johnson & Johnson, one of the few remaining companies with a top credit rating, is no longer at risk of a downgrade, S&P Global Ratings said Friday.】

item.title: 官员称马美贸易谈判 "进展顺利
item.description: 据东南亚国家的一位高级经济官员称，马来西亚与美国官员就关税问题举行的首次会议进展顺利，但这只是达成贸易协定的第一步。【原文：Malaysia’s initial meeting with US officials on tariffs went well but it’s only the first step toward forging a trade agreement, according to a top economic official from the Southeast Asian nation.】

item.title: 由于预算问题，洛杉矶被 S&P 降级为 AA- 级
item.description: S&P全球评级公司将洛杉矶的信用评级下调一级至AA-，理由是该市财政状况恶化，预算困难。【原文：Los Angeles had its credit rating downgraded one level to AA- by S&P Global Ratings, which cited the city’s deteriorating finances and budget woes for the move.】

item.title: 华尔街数据紧缩怀疑论者坐失转机交易
item.description: 在本周市场反弹期间，迈克尔-穆莱尼心不在焉，即使在股市飙升、美国企业借贷成本降低、国债收益率稳定的情况下也是如此。【原文：Michael Mullaney’s mind was elsewhere during the market rebound this week, even as stocks surged, borrowing costs for Corporate America eased and Treasuries settled down.】

item.title: S&P评级转为负面，比利时遭赤字警告
item.description: 由于对比利时预算赤字的担忧，S&P 全球评级公司将比利时的信用评级展望定为负面。【原文：S&P Global Ratings put a negative outlook on its assessment of Belgium’s creditworthiness over concerns about its budget deficits.】

item.title: 美联储警示资产估值压力带来的风险
item.description: 美联储在周五发布的一份报告中指出了与股票和房地产估值相关的脆弱性，称尽管本月早些时候一些市场出现下跌，但资产价格仍值得注意。【原文：The Federal Reserve noted vulnerabilities tied to stock and real-estate valuations in a report released Friday, saying that asset prices were notable despite declines in some markets earlier this month.】

item.title: Omers 的 Eric Haley 退休，私募股权投资公司内部发生最新变化
item.description: 安大略省地方政府工作人员养老基金的收购负责人埃里克-海利（Eric Haley）将于今年年底退休并离开公司，这是该计划私募股权业务的最新变动。【原文：The head of buyouts at Ontario’s pension fund for local government workers, Eric Haley, will retire and leave the firm at the end of the year in the latest change to the plan’s private equity business.】

item.title: 美国希望与俄罗斯在能源和金属领域开展战后联合业务
item.description: 据熟悉规划的人士透露，特朗普政府正在考虑将俄罗斯能源领域的合作作为赢得克里姆林宫的经济诱惑的一个关键因素，以推动达成结束乌克兰战争的协议。【原文：The Trump administration is looking at cooperation in the Russian energy sector as a key element of economic enticements to win over the Kremlin as it pushes for a deal to end the war in Ukraine, according to people familiar with the planning.】

item.title: 尾巴真的能拴住狗吗？新的杠杆 ETF 或许很快就能揭晓答案
item.description:
"小池塘 "问题

【原文：

The “small pond” problem

】

item.title: 雷德-霍夫曼说关税和削减开支可能会损害美国在人工智能领域的领先地位
item.description: LinkedIn 联合创始人、风险投资家里德-霍夫曼（Reid Hoffman）说，特朗普政府的关税和联邦支出削减可能会损害美国在人工智能领域的竞争力，并让中国占得先机。【原文：Reid Hoffman, the LinkedIn co-founder and venture capitalist, said the Trump administration’s tariffs and federal spending cuts could hurt America’s competitiveness in artificial intelligence and give China the upper hand.】

item.title: 津巴布韦财政部长会见美国官员寻求降低关税
item.description: 据津巴布韦财政部长姆图利-恩库比（Mthuli Ncube）称，津巴布韦与美国官员会面，争取降低美国总统唐纳德-特朗普本月早些时候对津巴布韦征收的关税。【原文：Zimbabwe met with US officials to argue for lower tariffs than those imposed on the nation by President Donald Trump earlier this month, according to Mthuli Ncube, the finance minister.】
